newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: We have sinned, South Africa's Salvation Army says.
newsitem.headline: We have sinned, South Africa's Salvation Army says.

text.p: The Salvation Army in South Africa confessed on Tuesday that it had sinned, by remaining silent to the evils of apartheid in the country's past.
The Christian organisation said merely staying out of politics was sometimes to do too little.

Its territorial commander for southern Africa, Commissioner Paul du Plessis, made a submission on Monday to the Truth and Reconciliation Commission that is trying to heal the racially divided nation by investigating the past, the Army said.
"The Army acknowledges its own sin of silence which resulted from its policy of political neutrality," it said in a statement.
"At the same time there were Salvationists of all ethnic backgrounds who had obeyed its dictates of conscience in opposing apartheid."
